description: A comforting beef stew made in a slow cooker with tender chunks of beef and vegetables.
ingredient: [{"name": "chuck roast", "units": "pounds", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/4"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "ground black pepper", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1/2"}, {"name": "olive oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "white onion", "units": "medium", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "dry red wine", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "celery", "units": "stalk", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "parsnips", "units": "medium", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "carrots", "units": "medium", "amount": "4"}, {"name": "new potatoes", "units": "pound", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "garlic", "units": "cloves", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "bay leaves", "units": null, "amount": "2"}, {"name": "beef stock", "units": "cups", "amount": "4"}, {"name": "cornstarch", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "water", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "fresh parsley leaves", "units": "for garnish", "amount": null}]
step_by_step: ["In a medium bowl, add the beef, flour, salt, and black pepper. Toss to coat the beef evenly with the flour.", "In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the oil. Once oil is hot, add half of the beef and sear for 3 to 4 minutes without stirring. Flip the beef over and brown the other side for 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer the seared beef into a bowl. Sear the remaining beef and transfer them into the bowl.", "Turn heat down to medium-low and add the onions. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently, to soften them slightly. Add the red wine and scrape up any brown bits stuck to the skillet.", "In a large slow cooker, add the celery, parsnips, carrots, potatoes, garlic, bay leaves, and beef stock. Add the browned beef and the onions and red wine from the skillet. Cover and cook on high for 5 to 6 hours or on low for 8 hours.", "The stew is cooked when the meat is fall-apart tender. Taste and season the stew to your liking. In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water and stir it into the stew to thicken it slightly.", "Ladle the beef stew into bowls and garnish with parsley."]
notes: Stews should be flexible; feel free to take liberties based on what you have in your fridge.
tags: beef, stew, slow cooker, comfort food
